decks.notes: The main concept of this deck is to quickly dump powerful creatures into the graveyard using cards like Entomb and Grief, and then reanimate them onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Daze and Force of Will to protect its combo pieces. By utilizing a combination of graveyard recursion and counter magic, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with large, impactful creatures while disrupting their game plan.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana to cast powerful spells and creatures, primarily utilizing Cloudpost lands and Crop Rotation to search for specific lands. The One Ring acts as a key component in the combo, along with Sowing Mycospawn and Disruptor Flute to generate tokens and disrupt opponent's strategies. Karn, the Great Creator helps to search for important artifacts such as Planar Nexus. The deck also includes powerful Eldrazi creatures like Emrakul and Ulamog for game-ending plays. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a heavy mana presence and powerful threats.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly assemble the combo of Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor to mill your library, putting Narcomoebas and Dread Return targets into the graveyard to win the game with a reanimated creature like Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruptive spells like Force of Will and Swords to Plowshares to protect the combo and interact with opponents. Cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Giver of Runes help protect your creatures from removal, while Aether Vial provides additional ways to put creatures into play. The deck aims to win as quickly and efficiently as possible.

This deck focuses on taking advantage of powerful aggressive threats like Goblin Rabblemaster and Broadside Bombardiers, backed up by disruptive elements like Chalice of the Void and Trinisphere to slow down the opponent. The main goal is to ramp up quickly with cards like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide, while controlling the board with cards like Blood Moon and Shatterskull Smashing. The inclusion of cards like Fable of the Mirror-Breaker and The One Ring provide additional ways to close out the game quickly. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its speed and disruptive elements.

This deck aims to quickly establish a board presence and overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures while utilizing disruptive spells like Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler to control the game. The deck includes powerful creatures like Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath and Stoneforge Mystic to provide additional threats and card advantage. The inclusion of equipment like Shuko and Kaldra Compleat enhances the aggression and efficiency of the creatures, while cards like Swords to Plowshares and Brainstorm provide essential removal and card selection. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all necessary colors for spells and creatures.

The deck focuses on quickly assembling the Cephalid Illusionist and Nomads en-Kor combo to mill through the library, then using Dread Return to bring back Thassa's Oracle for a win condition. The deck runs various ways to protect the combo pieces and disrupt the opponent's game plan, such as Force of Will and Teferi, Time Raveler. The deck also includes ways to dig for combo pieces and mana fixing with cards like Brainstorm and Noble Hierarch. The key concept revolves around creating and protecting the combo to win the game in a fast and efficient manner.

This deck utilizes a combination of powerful discard spells and mana acceleration to quickly fill the graveyard with key creatures and bring them back into play with reanimation spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate. The main goal is to cheat out powerful threats like Griselbrand and Archon of Cruelty to overwhelm the opponent and win the game. With a focus on disruption and speed, the deck aims to combo off and win the game as quickly as possible before the opponent has a chance to react.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Entomb and Grief, then using reanimation spells like Animate Dead and Reanimate to cheat them into play. It also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Daze to protect the combo. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with big threats early in the game, taking advantage of their lack of resources to deal with them effectively. It's a high-risk, high-reward deck that can win games quickly if the combo comes together.

This deck focuses on completing the Dark Depths combo as quickly as possible, using cards like Crop Rotation and Green Sun's Zenith to search for key pieces like Thespian's Stage. The deck also includes disruption in the form of Swords to Plowshares and Mox Diamond to help protect the combo. Knight of the Reliquary and Elvish Reclaimer are used to tutor for lands and further accelerate the combo. Overall, the deck aims to assemble the Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage combo and utilize it to win the game efficiently.

This Grixis Aggro deck focuses on casting efficient threats like Murktide Regent, Dragon's Rage Channeler, and Delver of Secrets, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze. The deck also includes removal spells like Unholy Heat and Lightning Bolt to deal with opposing threats. The mana base is optimized for speed and consistency, with a mix of fetch lands, dual lands, and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's mana base. Psychic Frog serves as additional disruption and card advantage in the deck.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly generate mana through rituals and fast mana sources, then utilize cards like Necrodominance and Beseech the Mirror to establish a dominant board presence. The goal is to combo off and win the game as early as possible, using Tendrils of Agony or Borne Upon a Wind as finishers. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Chancellor of the Annex to protect its game plan. The diversity of fast mana sources and combo pieces allows for flexibility and adaptability in different game situations.

The main strategy of this deck is to control the game by utilizing lands to generate value and disrupt the opponent. By using cards like Exploration, Crop Rotation, and Life from the Loam, the deck can quickly assemble powerful land combinations like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage or Urza's Saga. It also includes cards like Wasteland and Maze of Ith to disrupt the opponent's mana base and creatures. The deck aims to outvalue and outlast the opponent with its land-based control elements while also having the ability to win through creature beatdown or land-based combos.
